creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: canal on L with a number of boats parked along the banks; a row of houses lines the right side of the canal; a human figure at center walks away from a boat towards a house under a line of colorful hanging laundry
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和拾六年作　大阪運河 {jizuri, Shōwa jūrokunen saku, Ôsaka unga} | bottom, printed: Canal in Osaka | in pencil: Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist\'s seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: An Osaka Canal
